sourceDesc.p: Comments and notes to 入唐求法巡禮行記.

p.seg: As for the first and fourth ships, the ambassadors boarded the ships? Or: The ambassadors on board of the first and fourth ships boarded?

What is the object governed by 見? Is it the "whitish water" (白水) referred to above? Or is the sentence ungrammatical as it stands? If yes, would 見 have to be substituted by wàng 望, "look/gaze into the distance"? For 申云, see below.
According to CBETA, the collocation 申云 is rarely found in other texts but quite frequent in Ennin's diary.
